Irish party delegation pays respects to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Irish party delegation pays respects to Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Irish Workers' Party led by its President Seon Garland visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where President Kim Il Sung lies in state for perpetuity to pay respects to him yesterday.
 The head of the delegation wrote in the visitor's book that the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung, a great man, will always be remembered by the Korean people and the progressive people of the world.    
 The delegation arrived here on May 5.

Korean art troupe leaves for China
articles.content:
Korean art troupe leaves for China 
    Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- The state national art troupe of the DPRK left here today to attend the "meeting in Beijing," the second International Art Festival to be held in China.
 The troupe was seen off by Song Sok Hwan, vice-minister of culture, and Li Bin, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Chinese embassy here.

Credentials of new UNICEF representative to DPRK foreign minister
articles.content:
Credentials of new UNICEF representative to DPRK foreign minister 
    Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- Richard Bridle, UNICEF representative newly accredited to the DPRK, presented his credentials to foreign minister Paek Nam Sun today.
 After receiving the credentials, the foreign minister talked with him.
